titles.title: Defense Protection Fee Act
A bill to impose an additional fee on the importation of goods into the United States for purposes of offsetting the impact of defense expenditures on the United States economy.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/4/1987--Introduced. Defense Protection Fee Act - Directs the President to categorize all foreign countries as: (1) countries that are a party to a mutual defense treaty or rely on the United States for its defense; (2) neutral countries; or (3) countries, including countries that support terrorism, that cannot be categorized under (1) or (2). Imposes a defense protection fee (in addition to any other duties imposed) on imports into the United States. Sets forth a formula for the calculation of such fees. Requires the President to certify such fees imposed under categories (1) and (2) to the Commissioner of Customs.
